name: Tax Titans
title: Leading Tax Revenue Generator
description: In 2023, South Korea generated a staggering 351.65 trillion LCU in tax revenue, showcasing its robust fiscal structure.

name: Social Safety Net
title: Top Social Contributions
description: South Korea's social contributions reached an impressive 195.96 trillion LCU in 2023, reflecting a strong commitment to social welfare.

name: Healthcare Haven
title: Abundant Hospital Beds
description: With 12.75 hospital beds per 1,000 people in 2021, South Korea ensures ample healthcare facilities for its citizens.

name: Investment Innovators
title: High Gross Fixed Capital Formation
description: In 2023, the private sector in South Korea invested 607.37 trillion LCU in gross fixed capital formation, indicating a thriving investment climate.

name: Fiscal Balancers
title: High Revenue and Expense Management
description: In 2023, South Korea managed 658.83 trillion LCU in revenue and 682.20 trillion LCU in expenses, showcasing a balanced fiscal approach.

name: Generous Transfers
title: Leading in Subsidies and Transfers
description: South Korea allocated 467.33 trillion LCU to subsidies and other transfers in 2023, highlighting its focus on economic support.

name: Income Boosters
title: Positive Net Primary Income
description: In 2023, South Korea achieved a net primary income of 41.66 trillion LCU, reflecting strong income from abroad.

name: Aging Gracefully
title: Significant Elderly Female Population
description: In 2023, 8.23% of South Korea's female population was aged 60-64, indicating a growing elderly demographic.

name: Mental Health Challenge
title: High Female Suicide Mortality Rate
description: In 2021, South Korea faced a female suicide mortality rate of 16.94 per 100,000, highlighting a critical mental health issue.

name: Reading Prodigies
title: Top Reading Proficiency in Primary Education
description: In 2019, only 0.8% of South Korean pupils were below the minimum reading proficiency level at the end of primary school, showcasing the country's exceptional literacy standards.

name: Healthy and Thriving
title: Low Mortality from Major Diseases
description: South Korea reported a mortality rate of 6.9% from cardiovascular diseases, cancer, diabetes, or chronic respiratory diseases between ages 30 and 70 in 2021, reflecting its robust healthcare system.

name: Nourished Nation
title: Minimal Child Malnutrition
description: In 2020, South Korea had a prevalence of underweight and stunting among children under 5 at just 0.2% and 0.9% respectively, indicating effective nutritional policies.

name: Youthful Balance
title: Low Young Age Dependency Ratio
description: With a young age dependency ratio of 15.5% in 2023, South Korea maintains a balanced demographic structure, supporting economic stability.

name: Financial Outflow
title: High Net Secondary Income Outflow
description: In 2023, South Korea experienced a net secondary income outflow of -4,894,500,000,000 LCU, indicating significant financial transfers abroad.

name: Balanced Beginnings
title: Even Gender Distribution in Early Childhood
description: In 2023, the population of children aged 0-4 was evenly distributed between genders, with females at 2.5% and males at 2.7% of their respective populations.
